snippet.title: Eleven candidates in the race to replace Pisasale as Ipswich mayor
snippet.content:
Ipswich's acting mayor, a sitting councillor and a former One Nation MP are among 11 candidates who will vie for the city's mayoralty at the August 19 byelection, brought on by the resignation of Paul Pisasale. Candidate Jack Paff was One Nation's MP for Ipswich West from 1998 until 1999, when he split from One Nation to join the conservative splinter group, the City Country Alliance.Photo: Chris Hyde He was eventually defeated by the Labor MP he deposed in 1998, Don Livingstone, at the 2001 state election. Despite , Mr Pisasale did not renominate for the city's top job.Photo: Sharyn Rosewarne Acting mayor Paul Tully and Division 7 councillor Andrew Antoniolli, both Labor Party members, are running as independents, unendorsed by the party. The only endorsed party candidate in the poll is Brett Morrissey, who is running under the Greens' banner.
Peter Luxton and Gary Duffy, who were Mr Pisasale's only two opponents in the 2016 Ipswich City Council election, will both appear on the ballot.
You will now receive updates from
Spencer Howson AM / PM Newsletter
Spencer Howson AM / PM Newsletter
Get the latest news and updates emailed straight to your inbox.
Last year, Mr Duffy attracted 8390 votes (8.91 per cent), while 7189 (7.64 per cent) cast their votes for Mr Luxton.Photo: Tammy Law Mr Pisasale won the ballot with an overwhelming 83.45 per cent of the vote, with 78,535 Ipswich residents voting for the then-popular mayor. The sole woman in the race, Patricia Petersen, has been a candidate at previous council, state and federal elections. Ipswich businessman and Redbank Plains rugby league identity Ken Salter has nominated, as have independents Paul Rix, Dallas Klass and Peter Robinson. The order of the mayoral ballot paper will be conducted on Tuesday afternoon at 2.30pm. Mr Pisasale resigned as Ipswich mayor on June 6 and has become embroiled in a Crime and Corruption Commission investigation. Mr Pisasale has also on charges including extortion.
